All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AddFriendPacket
Either sends friend request to given user with username friend (Friend) by given user (User), or accepts friend request from Friend using User's account, if User has a friend request from Friend
ChangeSettingsPacket
Allows given user to change the settings of the given game if they are the current host.
CheckFriendRequestsPacket
Returns list of users who have sent a friend request to the given user
CheckFriendsPacket
Returns list of given user's friends
ClientPacket
Packet returned to client.
GameController
The controller that holds the general mappings where actions are processed
GetBoardPacket
Returns given game's entire board
GetChatPacket
Returns full game chat of given game
GetPlayersPacket
Returns list of players currently in given game.
GetSettingsPacket
Returns settings of given game
GetStatePacket
Returns the state of the lobby
InvalidGamePacket
Simple failure packet, returned when given game does not exist
InvalidSessionPacket
 
JoinLobbyPacket
Puts given user into lobby.
KickPlayerPacket
Allows given user to kick a player from the given game if they are the current host.
LeaveLobbyPacket
Removes given player from given game
ListPacket<A>
Simple packet used to list any object
MovePlayerPacket
Moves given player up to two spaces away.
NewGamePacket
Creates and returns a new game, setting the given user as the host of the game
NewSessionPacket
Packet used to return new user session UUID for future validation
NotInGamePacket
Simple failure packet, returned when given player is not in given game
PacketNotFoundPacket
Simple failure packet, returned when SuperPacket's function does not correlate to a packet class type
PlaceWallPacket
Uses given player to place a wall at the given position with the given direction.
QuoridorSpringApplication
 
ResultPacket
Simple packet used to return whether a packet failed or succeeded
ReturnBoardPacket
Returns the current player, winner (if someone has won), and positions of players and walls.
ReturnChatPacket
A packet that holds the list of Strings that make up a game's chat.
ReturnNewGamePacket
Packet used to return a game's ID to the client
ReturnPlayersPacket
Packet that holds a list of players
ReturnSettingsPacket
Returns game's settings: max player count, which player is the host, the amount of bots in game, and number of walls each player starts with.
ReturnStatePacket
Packet returns lobby state
ReturnTestPacket
Packet used for testing formatting
SendMessagePacket
Sends single message to server
ServerPacket
Abstract sub-packet that contains common variables uuid and session, corresponding to the user's session UUID and the game's ID respectively.
SessionGameCheckPacket
Is an abstract sub-packet used to quickly check common sub-packet requirements, which are toggled in their constructor.
StartGamePacket
Allows given user to start the given game if they are the current host.
StartSessionPacket
Generates and returns a new session, if given data is valid
SuperPacket
The packet directly required by the main controllers.
SuperPacket.Packets
Enum containing all of the function names and their corresponding packet class types
TestPacket
Packet meant to test formatting
UnregisteredPacket
Default packet, if SuperPacket function does not correspond to a packet class type
